page.title: 08Highbrook - Communications
page.content: Almost all homes in the area possess telephones and these are the most common method of communication, largely replacing letters except those of a business nature. There is a twice daily postal delivery.Within the last few years the one bus service crossing the area has been rerouted. It is no longer possible to reach a shopping centre by bus. The severely limited nature of the public bus service makes it necessary for most families to run a car and the more affluent run at least two. The area is a convenient location for car owners being close to mainline stations,three within a twelve mile radius, the motorway network ten miles away and Gatwick International airport also ten miles away. The short Bluebell rail track is not linked to mainline services.
